title: How to Update Your Xbox One Controller and Headset

steps.headline: Remove the batteries from your gaming controller.
steps.description: Do this to avoid unnecessary problems by accidentally turning it on.

steps.headline: Plug your Xbox One headset to your controller.
Connect the small end of the USB cable to your controller.
steps.description: The USB cable will be included with any headset that you have purchased specifically for your Xbox One console. If you own a play-and-charge kit, then you can use the USB cable that comes with it.

steps.headline: Connect the big end of the cable to the USB port of your console.
steps.description: The console's USB port should be located just above the battery housing.

steps.headline: Follow the instructions displayed on your screen.
steps.description: A notification pop-up will appear, indicating to the user that the Xbox One controller will require an update.

steps.headline: Select “Yes.” Keep the controller plugged in to the USB port of your console while the update is in progress.
steps.description: After the entire process has been completed, you will have the option of synchronizing another controller (if you have one).

steps.headline: Plug the headset and the USB cable into the second controller.
steps.description: Wait for the process to be completed once more.

text: Remove the batteries from your gaming controller. Do this to avoid unnecessary problems by accidentally turning it on. Plug your Xbox One headset to your controller.  Connect the small end of the USB cable to your controller. The USB cable will be included with any headset that you have purchased specifically for your Xbox One console. If you own a play-and-charge kit, then you can use the USB cable that comes with it. Connect the big end of the cable to the USB port of your console. The console's USB port should be located just above the battery housing. Follow the instructions displayed on your screen. A notification pop-up will appear, indicating to the user that the Xbox One controller will require an update. Select “Yes.” Keep the controller plugged in to the USB port of your console while the update is in progress. After the entire process has been completed, you will have the option of synchronizing another controller (if you have one). Plug the headset and the USB cable into the second controller. Wait for the process to be completed once more.
